The small tight rondo is a simple rondo variation with 3 or 4 players playing keep away from a defender in a small space.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.25″][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_image src=”https://ts-uploads.azureedge.net/marketing/2020/07/Small-Tight-Rondo-1.png” align=”center” align_tablet=”center” align_phone=”” align_last_edited=”on|desktop” _builder_version=”4.4.3″ max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” hover_enabled=”0″][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.4.3″ text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#151516″ max_width=”70%” max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_alignment=”center” hover_enabled=”0″]

Set Up

Create a small grid with 4 or 5 players and a ball. 

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.4.3″ text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#151516″ max_width=”70%” max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_alignment=”center” hover_enabled=”0″]

How It Works

Play starts with a 3v1 or 4v1 rondo keep away. When the defender wins the ball, they switch places on the outside with the player who lost it.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.4.3″ text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#151516″ max_width=”70%” max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_alignment=”center” hover_enabled=”0″]

Coaching Points

In general rondos are great to help players work on keeping possession of the ball and improve basic passing skills.

The difficulty of this exercise can be modified by limiting the number of touches players can take or changing the size of the grid.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]
